CatDescriptText: Frank Jacobs, St. Clair Village, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I imagine that I would ask him about the nuclear bombs which he has been setting off. I would ask him the reasons why he is doing so, because the resulting fallout is destructive to the entire world.  I don't think that he's testing the bombs because of the Berlin situation."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Jacobs wearing moustache, sweater with striped collar, and light colored overcoat with upturned collar, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
